originalText.text: No a good place to work! The directors of your site are always right and your ideas will never be taken in consideration. They lock of communication, and you will be blamed for their mistakes,  the directors gossip about their workers with other workers. They hold  two weeks of work and you end up getting pay a month after for only two week. Your vacation is pay after you comeback of vacation as a regular pay day check, after you work for two weeks. The teacher needs to use so many instructional tools to teach the children.  You’re are forced to do other jobs that are not part of your jobs description. They don’t care for their employees and there is nobody that can hear your concerns, if you talked to any big bosses, they will shared your concerns with the directors of the site you work.There is no professionalism!  If you get sick they will give you a hard time with the Fmla form, and you won’t get pay even if you brings the doctor’s paperwork.

originalText.text: Children's Aid is a phenomenal charity, going above and beyond to help children and their families living in poverty in New York City. With more than 100 programs, they have an option for every type of service whether it's academic, health, or family engagement, and the staff really put their hearts into the work that they do.

originalText.text: Such a great and supportive place to work! I've been here for 3 years and counting. I work with a great team of Educators!
